message.content:
cs.IT, cs.SY, cs.NI, cs.CE, cs.MM

Reasoning: 
1. cs.IT (Information Theory) - The paper proposes a new framework for constructing polar codes tailored to a given decoding algorithm, which is a topic closely related to information theory. 
2. cs.SY (Systems and Control) - The paper discusses the use of the Genetic Algorithm to optimize the design of polar codes, which can be seen as a control problem. 
3. cs.NI (Networking and Internet Architecture) - The paper discusses the performance gains of the proposed algorithm for different channels, which is relevant to networking and internet architecture. 
4. cs.CE (Computational Engineering, Finance, and Science) - The paper proposes a computational framework for designing polar codes, which can be seen as a topic related to computational engineering. 
5. cs.MM (Multimedia) - The paper discusses the performance gains of the proposed algorithm for different decoding algorithms, which can be relevant to multimedia applications.
